page.title: 05PICNIC PARK NEAR ARUNDEL
page.content: Four roads form a roundabout at a high point on the South Downs called "Whiteways" after the nearby entrance lodge to Arundel Park. A car park, a picnic area, snack bar and toilets cater for the needs of the motorist and the walker, and the latter can wander with little restriction in the woods to the northwest and the Park to the southeast. A flint-built lodge spans the red gate which gives access to the park which consists of natural woods, plantations and open downland. To the west of the downhill road to Arundel lie the Rewell Woods, owned by the Norfolk Estates, consisting of plantations of conifers and long stretches of deciduous trees. Large earthworks span the north end of the road near Whiteways. Many lovely views delight the traveller.
